enWisdom: Evil is [a cause of] regret
Evil makes its rider fall
Evil is the ugliest of gates
Evil is pestilent speech
Evil is the symbol of destruction
Evil degrades and strikes down
Evil is punishable and brings dishonour (or is requited)

Wisdom: الشَّرُّ [الشَّرَهُ‏] مَرْكَبُ الْحِرْصِ وَالْهَوَى مَرْكَبُ الْفِتْنَةِ
enWisdom: Evil is the riding mount of greed and vain desire is the riding mount of discord

Wisdom: الشَّرِيرُ لَا يَظُنُّ بِأَحَدٍ خَيْراً لِأَنَّهُ لَا يَرَاهُ إِلَّا بِطَبْعِ نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: The wicked person does not think good of anyone because he does not see them except through [the lenses of] his own nature

Wisdom: الشَّرُّ كَامِنٌ فِي طَبِيعَةِ كُلِّ أَحَدٍ فَإِنْ غَلَبَهُ صَاحِبُهُ بَطَنَ وَإِنْ لَمْ يَغْلِبْهُ ظَهَرَ
enWisdom: Evil is concealed in everyone’s nature, so if its possessor overcomes it, it remains hidden and if he doesn’t overcome it, it is manifested

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمُلَابَسَةَ الشَّرِّ فَإِنَّكَ تُنِيلُهُ نَفْسَكَ قَبْلَ عَدُوِّكَ وَتُهْلِكُ بِهِ دِينَكَ قَبْلَ إِيصَالِهِ إِلَى غَيْرِكَ
enWisdom: Beware of surrounding yourself with evil, for you will be affected by it yourself before [harming] your enemy and you will destroy your religion by it before conveying it to others
The most severely punished thing is evil
Verily in evil there is impudence

Wisdom: رُبَّ شَرٍّ فَاجَاكَ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا تَحْتَسِبُهُ
enWisdom: Many an evil may suddenly come upon you from whence you least expect it
The most evil of all is one who is not ashamed of [his actions in front of] the people and does not fear Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ يَتَّقِيهِ النَّاسُ مَخَافَةَ شَرِّهِ
enWisdom: The worst person is one whom people are cautious about out of fear of his evil

Wisdom: طَاعَةُ دَوَاعِي الشُّرُورِ تُفْسِدُ عَوَاقِبَ الْأُمُورِ
enWisdom: Obedience to the calls of the wicked corrupts the outcome of matters

Wisdom: لَمْ يَتَعَرَّ مِنَ الشَّرِّ مَنْ لَمْ يَتَجَلْبَبِ الْخَيْرَ
enWisdom: He who does not wear the gown of good has not disrobed from evil

Wisdom: مَنِ اقْتَحَمَ لُجَجَ الشُّرُورِ لَقِيَ الْمَحْذُورَ
enWisdom: One who plunges into the depths of evil meets with danger [and adversity]

Wisdom: مَنْ فَعَلَ الشَّرَّ فَعَلَى نَفْسِهِ اعْتَدَى
enWisdom: One who does evil has [actually] transgressed against his soul
One who hates evil is safeguarded [from it]
The good deed that is followed by hellfire is not a good deed
